questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: When adding fractions with the same denominator, add the numerators: 1 + 2 = 3, so 1/4 + 2/4 = 3/4

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: To multiply fractions, multiply numerators and denominators: 1x1=1, 2x3=6

questions.text: Match each multiplication to its product.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Each fraction times the whole number equals 2: 1/2 x 4 = 2, 1/3 x 6 = 2, 1/4 x 8 = 2

questions.text: When you divide by a fraction, the answer is always smaller.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Dividing by a fraction less than 1 actually makes the number bigger. Example: 2 / 1/2 = 4

questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: A recipe needs 2/3 cup of flour. If you want to make half the recipe, how much flour do you need?
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.explanation: When adding fractions with the same denominator, add the numerators: 2 + 1 = 3, so 2/5 + 1/5 = 3/5

questions.explanation: Order: Find common denominator, Convert fractions, Add numerators, Write answer

questions.text: A runner completes 3/4 of a mile in the morning and 2/3 of a mile in the afternoon. How far did the runner go in total?

questions.text: A garden is 3/4 acre. If 2/3 of the garden is planted with vegetables, how much of the acre has vegetables?

questions.explanation: Half of means multiply by 1/2; plus means add; portions of means multiply

questions.text: A painter uses 2/3 gallon of paint for each room. If she has 5 gallons of paint, how many rooms can she paint completely?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 5 / 2/3 = 5 x 3/2 = 15/2 = 7 1/2, so she can paint 7 complete rooms

questions.text: A rectangular garden has a length of 4 1/2 feet and width of 2 2/3 feet. What is the area of the garden?
questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.text: Order the steps to solve: A recipe makes 2 1/2 dozen cookies. If you want 1/3 of the recipe, how many cookies?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Convert mixed number, multiply fractions, convert to cookies, state answer

questions.text: When you multiply a number by a fraction less than 1, the product is always less than the original number.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Multiplying by a fraction less than 1 takes a part of the number, resulting in a smaller product

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: Finding 'of' means multiply; splitting into fractional pieces means divide; combining means add

questions.text: A box contains 24 crayons. If 5/8 of them are used, how many crayons are left?

questions.text: A farmer has 15 acres. He plants corn on 2/5 of the land and wheat on 1/3 of the land. How many acres are left unplanted?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 2/5 + 1/3 = 6/15 + 5/15 = 11/15 planted. 15 x 11/15 = 11 acres planted. 15 - 11 = 4 acres left

questions.text: A recipe calls for 3/4 cup of flour, but you only want to make 2/3 of the recipe. Then you decide to double that amount. How much flour do you need?
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: 3/4 x 2/3 = 6/12 = 1/2 cup for 2/3 recipe. Double: 1/2 x 2 = 1 cup
